Description: Body sherd of Chian black-figured Animal pottery chalice; white slip; interior glazed streaky black; exterior: black-figure decoration consisting of bird (tail feathers with added red stripe remaining) to right; incised rosette with red centre as filling ornament; at left, undetermined motif.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 331, no. 1599)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1315) (phase 2)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
